texto: ISO 10017:2021(E) ï»¿ Introduction Variability is inherent in the behaviour and outcome of practically all processes and activities, even under conditions of apparent stability. Such variability can be observed, over the total life cycle, in the quantifiable characteristics of processes and in the resulting products and services. Statistical techniques can help to measure, describe, analyse, interpret and model variability (whether dealing with a relatively limited amount of data or with large data sets).
